text: The 2019 Malaysia Cup (Malay: Piala Malaysia 2019) was the 93rd edition of Malaysia Cup tournament organised by Football Association of Malaysia (FAM) and Malaysian Football League (MFL). The 2019 Malaysia Cup began on August with a preliminary round. A total of 16 teams took part in the competition. The teams were divided into four groups, each containing four teams. The group leaders and runners-up teams in the groups after six matches qualified to the quarterfinals. Perak were the defending champions. They were eliminated by Selangor in the quarter-finals. == Format == In the competition, the top eleven teams from the 2019 Malaysia Super League were joined by the top five teams from the 2019 Malaysia Premier League. The teams were drawn into four groups of four teams. == Round and draw dates == The draw for the 2019 Malaysia Cup will be held on 23 July 2019. == Seeding == {| class=wikitable !width=25%|Pot 1 !width=25%|Pot 2 !width=25%|Pot 3 !width=25%|Pot 4 |- valign=top |rowspan=4| Johor Darul Ta'zim Pahang Selangor Kedah |rowspan=4| Perak Melaka United Terengganu PJ City |rowspan=4| PKNS Felda United PKNP Sabah |rowspan=4| PDRM UiTM Negeri Sembilan Pulau Pinang |} == Group stage == ===Group A=== ===Group B=== ===Group C=== ===Group D=== ==Bracket== ==Knockout stage== The first legs was played in September 2019, and the second legs will be played in October 2019. } |} === Quarter-finals === Johor Darul Ta'zim won 5−1 on aggregate. \---- Kedah won 6−2 on aggregate. \---- Pahang won 6−1 on aggregate. \---- Selangor won 3−2 on aggregate. \---- === Semi-finals === The first legs will be played on 19 October 2019, and the second legs will be played on 26 October 2019. |} 8−8 on aggregate. Kedah won on away goals. \---- Johor Darul Ta'zim won 5−1 on aggregate. \---- === Final === The final was played on 2 November 2019. == Statistics == === Goalscorers === Players sorted first by goals, then by last name. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- |1 | style="text-align:left;"| Safawi Rasid | style="text- align:left;"|Johor Darul Ta'zim |11 |- |2 | style="text-align:left;"| Dickson Nwakaeme | style="text-align:left;"|Pahang |9 |- |3 | style="text- align:left;"| Jonathan Bauman | style="text-align:left;"|Kedah |8 |- |4 | style="text-align:left;"| Lazarus Kaimbi | style="text-align:left;"|Pahang |7 |- |rowspan=4|5 | style="text-align:left;"| Diogo Luís Santo | style="text- align:left;"|Johor Darul Ta'zim |rowspan=5|6 |- | style="text-align:left;"| Gonzalo Cabrera | style="text-align:left;"|Johor Darul Ta'zim |- | style="text-align:left;"| Kipré Tchétché | style="text-align:left;"|Terengganu |- |} === Hat-tricks === {| class="wikitable sortable" !
